conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a black-and-white movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: Based on your preference for black-and-white movies, I recommend "To Kill a Mockingbird" (1960). This classic film, based on Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, features an all-black cast and is known for its powerful message about racial justice.

conversation.speaker: USER

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: For a black-and-white genre with an intriguing what-if story, I recommend 'The Equalizer' (2014) starring Denzel Washington as Jan Tucker, a detective who uses unconventional methods to fight against injustice.

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend 'The Best Years of Our Lives' (1946). This classic film follows three World War II veterans as they return home and face the changes in their lives. Starring icons Myrna Loy and Teresa Wright, this movie offers a heartfelt exploration of resilience and adapting to new circumstances.
